availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Aquilla C. Clark (Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Helen Hedges Clark in Union County, Kentucky, in 1826. Father of Rachel Clark, America Clark, Nancy Clark, Sarah Clark, John Clark, William Clark, Mary E. Clark, James C. Clark, Lucinda Clark, Francis Clark, and Joanna Clark. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District, p. 127B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 598.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562193.
"Aquilla C. Clark (1807-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial #110982422, accessed July 26, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110982422/aquilla-c-clark.
